page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: {POTATOES. Potatoes are planted in April. The fields are only used for potatoes once in five years. The crop is sprayed to kill the weeds to let it grow. When the {potatoes }are ready for picking{ they are sprayed to kill the shaws. The farmers get a "tattie squad"(a lot of people) and a "tattie digger." This digs the drills out and the squad lift the potatoes into baskets. Then they are thrown into a potato box. Some boxes go to the tattie stores and some are used for feeding animals. {PEAS} peas are grown in one part of ARDOCH because other crops like barley won't grow. Viners cut the peas and a lorry carts them away and a machine sprays them. They are sold as tinned peas. {
